availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Newt Turner (Caldwell County, KY, merchant and county judge)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, merchant and judge. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Jane Turner. Father of Eunice Turner and Mary Turner. Merchant in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. County judge in Princeton in 1860. County judge in Princeton in 1861. County judge in Princeton in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, 345A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 779.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 112.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862,” in 1863 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 24 (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), 304.
Find A Grave, “John N. Turner (1819-1889),” Memorial #18481142, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18481142 (accessed May 15, 2018).
KYR-0001-017-0167.
